Can't believe a solo can be turned into a choir so easily for this one, btw. o.O  
  
Vuliev (a formal, professional, dead voice): I Admit that in the [past](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=past) We've been a Nasty 3:D  
 They weren't kidding when they called us, well, a *[lich](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lich)* :P  
 But You'll find that nowa*days* :D  
 We've mended all our *[way](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=way)s* O:)  
 [Repent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Repent)ed, seen the [Light](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Light), and made a [Switch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Switch)!  
 To. This. -\_-  
  
 Enezesku (kinda high pitched and..skeezy?): And I *[Fortune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fortune)*-ately know a little *MAGIC*; >;)  
 It's a talent that we \*always\* have possessed! :D  
 And Dear Lady, *please-don't-laugh* (!)  
 I use-*it-on-behalf* :)  
 Of the mis'rable, the [lonely](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=lonely), and dep'ressed!  **O:'(  
([pathetic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pathetic))** >:(

Posted By: rollinsclone (1/23/2013 10:47:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is fantastic. It's fast, powerful, efficient, and dumb. Really. Really. Dumb. Not as in "it's stupid because it's power-crept." but as in "it takes such an abyssmally small amount of skill to play." It's almost insulting to me as a player, when compared to the original, how little decision-making this card has. But at the same time, I love me some B/W. 2/5 for being skill-less, 5/5 for power. So I'll give it a composite 4/5.
posts.html:
This card is fantastic. It's fast, powerful, efficient, and dumb. Really. Really. Dumb. Not as in "it's stupid because it's power-crept." but as in "it takes such an abyssmally small amount of skill to play." It's almost insulting to me as a player, when compared to the original, how little decision-making this card has. But at the same time, I love me some B/W. 2/5 for being skill-less, 5/5 for power. So I'll give it a composite 4/5.

@osprey\_93 it would protect him from the removal but he would not disappear for your opponents turn. Sundial immediately ends the turn skipping every remaining step including your end step. And then your open to alot more removal.
